titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Gardner, Judgment
CWG6468

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Bourbon circuit court

The Commonwealth Plff
agt upon Indictment for Keeping Disorderly house found at the April Term 1862
John Gardner Deft
1865 April 17 Judgment for Plff $50.00

The Same Plff
agt Upon Indictment for Keeping Disorderly House found at the April Term 1862
Eliza Gardner Deft
1865 April 17 Judgment for Plff $50.00

Att
James Paton Clk. B. C C

I would respectfully ask the remission of the above fines, The indictments were found long ago and since that the for the last two or three years the parties above named have been deporting themselves with great propriety so that so far from theire being any complaint against them theire good conduct has become the subject of general remark. The Clerk and Sheriff having fees against them in the above cases have voluntarily remitted them and as the parties are poor and struggling as I believe honestly to make a living I think it would be entirely proper that the fines should be remitted

Bourbon Cir Ct
vs
John Gardner
for $50 --
&
Eliza Gardner
for $50.
20th May 1865
